results.title: Space science: galaxies and the universe
results.brief_description: Describes irregular, spiral and elliptical galaxies. Illustrates quasars and the two types of stellar populations. Demnonstrates the three most prominent theories of the expanding universe. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Space science: exploring the moon
results.brief_description: Illustrates the 400-year history of lunar exploration, from Galileo’s first telescopic view to man’s first step on the moon’s surface. Identifies major surface features, using ancient maps, photographs and film. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Space science: an introduction
results.brief_description: Shows how speed and direction determine whether a space vehicle will go into orbit, fall back to earth or escape the earth. Demonstrates terms such as thrust, acceleration, G-Forces and Zero G conditions. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Space science for beginners
results.brief_description: Explains basic concepts involved in children’s questions about the solar systems, orbits, propulsion, gravity and applications of space flight.

results.title: Space probes: exploring our solar system
results.brief_description: Tells the story of efforts to explore the outer regions of space from the launching of Pioneer 1 in 1958 to the program in 1964 for gaining more information about the moon, the sun, and the solar system. Examines the problems involved in collecting and relaying the information from space probes and explains how such problems are being, or will be, solved in preparation for manned space expeditions.

results.title: Space invaders: sexual harrasment at work
results.brief_description: Space Invaders is a series of 7 trigger films designed to encourage the discussion of sexual harassment in the workplace; to raise awareness of the issue within organisations, to assist women to recognise sexual harassment for what it is, and to develop ways of dealing with it.

results.title: Space invaders: sexual harassment at work (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Sexual harassment at work is today recognised as one of the most pressing of all issues facing management. This series of seven trigger films, (2 mins. each), is designed to help men and women in the workplace come to terms with sexual harassment and re-align their own attitudes and behaviour.

results.title: Space in the seventies: exploration of the planets
results.creator_credit: Graphic Films, National Aeronautics and Space Administration, Lester Novros and Colin Cantwell
results.brief_description: This film very briefly covers the early notions we had about space, and then progresses to actual data collected from space flights to the Moon, Mars and Saturn. Information and findings are presented by artists’ impressions, animation, and computer printouts. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Space flight
results.brief_description: Made by a special “Plasti-Cine” technique, in this film the hero, Dan, passes an amusing set of tests for health fitness, then flies a space rocket to the planet Venus. After battling the demon Nicotine, Dan persuades the Venusians to destroy the groves of cigarette trees to abolish smoking.

results.title: Space cowboys
results.creator_credit: Mad Chance, Clint Eastwood, Clipsal Films, Village Roadshow Pictures and Malpaso Company
results.brief_description: In the 1950s, a US test pilot team, codenamed Team Daedalus, have been training to become the first Americans in space. They are passed over by NASA who decide to send a chimp instead. Over the years, Frank Corvin (Clint Eastwood), Hawk Hawkins (Tommy Lee Jones), Jerry O’Neill (Donald Sutherland) and Tank Sullivan (James Garner) have been forgotten and move onto other professions - Corvin becomes an aerospace engineer, Hawkins, a freelance pilot, Sullivan, a Baptist minister, and O’Neill, an astrophysicist who designs roller coasters in his free time. The four all live a quiet life until NASA learns that a Russian satellite will crash into earth, causing a major communication blackout, unless a failure in the satellite’s system can be repaired. When NASA discovers that the satellite’s system is identical to one Corvin designed, they ask him for help. He agrees, but only if he can do the repairs himself and that the original Team Daedalus can come along as his crew. ‘Space cowboys’ was produced and directed by Clint Eastwood. Cast also includes James Cromwell, Marcia Gay Harden, Courtney B. Vance, Loren Dean and William Devane.
